column3: str
F-Father... <sniff> Father, please...
Thank you for delivering my father's present, friend! You truly are one of the saint's little helpers! Just watch me─by next Starlight, I'll be all better and living with my father again!
That was one of the best stories I've ever heard! When I grow up, I want to be an adventurer like you...or a merchant like my father. I haven't decided yet, but I still have time!
Everyone says the city's full of little helpers, but none of them come here. Do you think it's because they don't want to get sick like us?
I got a present! I truly got a present! I knew the Spinner'd hear my prayers─I've been a good boy this year!
I wonder what Reauverre was so happy about the other day? Speaking of Reauverre─is he not feeling well? He's been sleeping for a terribly long time...
Reauverre's finally on his feet again! I was afraid he'd never wake up. That happens here sometimes, you know...
I want to go on adventures! Do you think I can be an adventurer too someday?
Just between you and me, the only gift I want for Starlight is to see Mother and Father once more...
For this Starlight, this gift shall suffice. But by this time next year, I must triumph over my illness and return to Mother and Father. May the Spinner hear my prayer...
Of course I am curious as to what Reauverre keeps hidden under his bed, but it simply would not be...<Emphasis>proper</Emphasis> to peek.
They say Reauverre has awakened. The boy gave the physicians a dreadful fright.
An intriguing tale, to say the least. Would that I, too, could become an adventurer one day! But first, I must triumph over this illness that afflicts me.
<cough> <cough> ...F-Forgive me. I do not mean to be rude. I just want to go outside and play with my friends, but the grown-ups tell me my body is still─<cough>─too weak...
<cough> <cough> I...I never thought a little helper would bring a gift to me. I'm so...<cough>...happy...
Reauverre seemed so sad of late... Now he's sleeping and won't─<cough>─wake up. I hope I didn't give him what I have... <cough> <cough>
<cough> They say Reauverre finally opened his eyes. I'm so happy to hear he's feeling...<cough>...better again.
<cough> <cough> Thank you for the lovely story, adventurer. You will come back and tell us more, yes? They tell me it will be a while before I can...<cough>...go outside again...
You're not a little helper, now are you? Not that I mind, of course! For I am no child, but a big girl with no need for little toys and trinkets!
A present! A little helper truly brought me a present! I knew that I'd been a good little─er, a responsible big girl!
I do hope Reauverre will get better soon... Do you think if I ask nicely, the Spinner will answer another prayer? I mean, even though She already sent me a present...
Reauverre has opened his eyes again, and he seems to be happier and healthier than ever! Truly, the Spinner has answered my prayers!
What a remarkable tale! I simply must travel the realm one day and see such sights with my own eyes!
You are the kind adventurer who has come to assist us in our Starlight festivities, yes? Thank you for giving our poor children a reason to smile.
Reauverre? The worst of his symptoms had subsided. Why, I cannot fathom how this could have happened...
We are at a loss as for what to do with the boy, friend. Pray lend us your aid.
The wonders you have worked for our precious Reauverre can only be described as miracles. You are no less than a hero to the children now, friend─and to all of us.
